org.magnos.task
Class Task<R>

java.lang.Object
  org.magnos.task.Task<R>
Type Parameters:
R - The result type.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, org.magnos.service.EventHandler<Task<?>>, TaskEventHandler, TaskListener<R>
Direct Known Subclasses:
TaskCollection, TaskFork
public abstract class Task<R>
extends java.lang.Object
implements TaskEventHandler, TaskListener<R>, java.lang.Runnable

A single action that can be executed synchronously or asynchronously. A task can finish successfully, because an exception was thrown, before it started by being canceled, or by not completing by a specific time. A task uses a state machine which can hold Initialized, Waiting, Running, and Finished states. Sub-states of Finished exist which are Success, TimedOut, Error, and Canceled.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Method Detail

execute

protected abstract R execute()
Performs the Task's job.

Returns:
The result of the Task.

sync

public R sync()
Executes this task, waits for it to finish, and returns the result. If the task is already currently running this will wait for it to finish. If the task has already finished the result will be returned immediately.

Returns:
The result of the Task.

async

public boolean async(TaskListener<R> async)
Executes this task and notifies the given listener when it has finished. The task can only be executed asynchronously if it has not been executed yet or it has been reset (i.e. its not waiting, running, or finished).

Parameters:
async - The listener to the events of the task.
Returns:
True if the task will execute asynchronously, otherwise false.

async

public boolean async()
Executes this task and notifies itself when it has finished. The task can only be executed asynchronously if it has not been executed yet or it has been reset (i.e. its not waiting, running, or finished).

Returns:
True if the task will execute asynchronously, otherwise false.

run

public void run()
Performs the actual execution of the task. This is called by the handler.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

cancel

public boolean cancel()
Cancels this Task if it is currently in the waiting state. This will also immediately notify the listener if the task can be canceled.

Returns:
True if the task has been canceled, otherwise false.

reset

public boolean reset()
Resets this task so it can be executed again only if it is in the Finished state.

Returns:
True if the task has been reset, otherwise false.

join

public boolean join()
Waits for this task to finish. If this task has already finished this will return immediately. This may fail and return false if the current thread is interrupted while its waiting.

Returns:
True if the task has finished, otherwise false.

join

public boolean join(long timeout)
Waits for this task to finish. If this task has already finished this will return immediately. This may fail if the current thread is interrupted or the wait times out, which will return false.

Parameters:
timeout - The maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait to finish.
Returns:
True if the task has finished, otherwise false.

fork

public TaskFork<R> fork()
Forks this task by creating a duplicate task which invokes this tasks execute method. Therefore any variables accessed in this task's execute method will be modified by the returned Task once ints executed.

Returns:
A new task which calls this task's execute method.

waitForState

public boolean waitForState(int desiredState)
Pauses the current thread until the given state of the task is reached. If the current thread is interrupted this will return before the state is reached and false will be returned.

Parameters:
desiredState - The set of acceptable states to wait to reach.
Returns:
True if any of the states have been reached, otherwise false.

                        java.lang.Throwable error)
The method invoked when a task executes and throws an error.

Specified by:
onTaskError in interface TaskListener<R>
Parameters:
source - The task that finished after throwing an exception.
error - The exception thrown.

                          R result)

Specified by:
onTaskSuccess in interface TaskListener<R>
Parameters:
source - The task that finished successfully.
result - The result of the task.

onTaskTimeout

public void onTaskTimeout(Task<R> source)
The method invoked when a task times out. A task can time out while its running or while its waiting.

Specified by:
onTaskTimeout in interface TaskListener<R>
Parameters:
source - The task that timed out.

onTaskFinish

public void onTaskFinish(Task<R> source)
The method invoked when a task is completely finished. The task either succeeded, errored, was canceled, or timed out.

Specified by:
onTaskFinish in interface TaskListener<R>
Parameters:
source - The task that finished.

getState

public org.magnos.util.State getState()
Returns the state machine of this Task. Use of this should be avoided, especially acquiring the lock of the state. This may be used to wait for a possible set of states but should only be done carefully.

Returns:
The state machine of this task.

getHandler

public TaskEventHandler getHandler()
Returns the TaskHandler this tasks is using to perform execution.

Returns:
The TaskHandler of this task.

setHandler

public void setHandler(TaskEventHandler handler)
Sets the TaskHandler of this Task. This is not a thread safe method.

Parameters:
handler - The new TaskHandler for this task.

setTimeout

public void setTimeout(long timeout)
Sets the timeout of this task in milliseconds. By default the timeout is 2^63-1 milliseconds (292 million years). The timeout is the maximum amount of time a sync method will wait for the finished status before it tries to cancel and ignore the results of the task.

Parameters:
timeout - The timeout of the Task in milliseconds.

getTimeout

public long getTimeout()
Returns the timeout of this task.

Returns:
The timeout of this task in milliseconds.

True if the state of this task is waiting, otherwise false.
